task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 68°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the roofline and base of the building clearly to estimate its height, so I'll tilt the camera upward while keeping the building centered.
I’m no longer facing the target building (should be ~68°E), so I should rotate right to re-center it while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need both the base and roofline in view; tilting up will help capture the top of the main building while staying aligned to ~68°E.
The heading has drifted back to 0°N, so I must rotate right to ~68°E again to keep the target building centered for a height estimate.
To give a height estimate now, I should keep the building centered and tilt up enough to see the roofline clearly.
I’m again facing 0°N instead of the target at ~68°E, so I need to rotate right to re-acquire the building while keeping the upward pitch.
Instead of more looking, I should move closer to reduce perspective uncertainty and better judge floor count and height.
I need to reorient toward the target building at ~68°E from my current ~20° heading, so I’ll rotate right about 48° to face it.
I’m still about 20° left of the desired ~68°E view, so I’ll rotate slightly right to align directly with the building façade.
The view is back at 20°N; to face the target at ~68°E I should rotate right by about 48° again.
To lock onto the target at ~68°E from 48°NE, I should rotate a bit further right by ~20°.
The heading keeps snapping back to 20°N, so I should directly rotate to an absolute ~68°E using a custom yaw of +48° from here.
I need to stop oscillating and just estimate from this viewpoint by tilting up to capture the roofline of the main building.
The view is again at 0°N; I should rotate right to ~68°E while keeping pitch up so the building’s top stays visible for height estimation.
Now that I'm correctly facing ~68°E, I should tilt up to see the roofline and use apparent floor count to estimate total height.
Since tilting up keeps resetting my heading, I should keep this pitch and rotate right to reacquire the building at ~68°E.
I should move closer along the approach to better judge the building’s number of storeys and overall vertical extent.
